alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:09PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Otero County through 245 PM MDT... At 209 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Sunspot, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alamogordo, La Luz, Holloman Air Force Base and Boles Acres. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 201 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 57 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
